content.question: The path of a particle in the <math alttext="x y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-plane is described by the parametric equations <math alttext="x of t, equals sine t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></math> and <math alttext="y of t equals, e raised to the t power, minus t squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></math>. Which of the following gives the total distance traveled by the particle from <math alttext="t equals 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></math> to <math alttext="t equals 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="the integral from 1 to 2, of, the square root of, sine squared t, plus, open parenthesis, e raised to the t power, minus t squared, close parenthesis, squared, end root, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo stretchy="true">∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msqrt><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="2.4ex" width="0.0em"></mspace><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the integral from 1 to 2, of, the square root of, cosine squared t, plus, open parenthesis, e raised to the t power, minus 2 t, close parenthesis, squared, end root, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo stretchy="true">∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msqrt><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="2.4ex" width="0.0em"></mspace><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the integral from 1 to 2, of, the square root of, cosine t plus, open parenthesis, e raised to the t power, minus 2 t, close parenthesis, end root, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo stretchy="true">∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><msqrt><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="2.4ex" width="0.0em"></mspace><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></msqrt><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the integral from 1 to 2, of, open parenthesis, cosine squared t, plus, open parenthesis, e raised to the power t, minus 2 t, close parenthesis, squared, close parenthesis, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo stretchy="true">∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="2.4ex" width="0.0em"></mspace><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the integral from 1 to 2, of, the square root of, cosine squared t, plus, open parenthesis, e raised to the t power, minus 2 t, close parenthesis, squared, end root, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo stretchy="true">∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msqrt><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="2.4ex" width="0.0em"></mspace><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.6: (BC ONLY) Solving Motion Problems Using Parametric and Vector-Valued Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
